comments.raw_text:
For consistency and quality, we need to create three web-sized versions of this video from the same full-quality source:

H264 version (mp4 container)
Theora version (ogv container)
WebM version (webm container)

They should each be under 15 MB, and look good at 480 x 270.

The MP4 source file that Ben linked to uses AVC, a weird proprietary Apple codec, so it's hard to work with. That's why Ken's conversion failed.

There are two possible solutions:

1. ask Bobby or someone who is really good at FFMPEG to do this. He was able to get this going, but the quality is only so-so: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/8176339/Mozilla_2011.webm 

2. ask the agency who made it to provide a better source file, using anything but AVC codec. MPEG2 would work.

#2 seems smartest.

Ben, I am sorry this got delayed. It got buried during the email outage.

comments.raw_text:
P.S., this is necessary to ensure that users don't need Flash to watch the video. Supporting HTML5 and open video is a big part of the "Mozilla Story."

By providing three source files, we ensure that users of any HTML5 enabled browser can watch, regardless of which formats the browser vendor chooses to support. This includes iPads, older versions of Firefox, and etc.

Cheers,
Ben
